content: @Pietro Albini There was a regression in proxied behaviour in rustup 1.22.0 which was only caught after release. It's a victim of the current pandemic in the sense that the author of env_proxy knew about it, fixed it, but failed to publish the crate due to the changing times. I am preparing a 1.22.1 which is 1.22.0 with just their patch to fix that, and I'd really like to push it out today if you have time?
@Daniel Silverstone sure! let's do it in the afternoon?
Cool, that should give us a chance to bottom why the dockers aren't working, and maybe merge the website fix too, depending on your workload :grinning:
I have a lot of green ticks going on, I'd guess another 10-15min before it's safe to do a dev-deploy to check things (incl. the website fix)

@Pietro Albini Green ticks across the board on the builds with that fixed rustc hash, thank you. Could you do a dev-deploy so the website can be checked? I'll then double-check the proxy behaviour when I get back from viewing a flat for my mother in law, and then we can promote.
sure
kicked off
@Daniel Silverstone done
dev.rustup.rs is invalidating

I can confirm that it's honouring HTTPS_PROXY now, so we're probably good to release unless inejge comes back with a problem. Would you be good to start the machinery to promote 1.22.1 at, say, 15:00 UTC?
sure
@simulacrum do you want to post a post on the main blog for rustup 1.22.1?
https://github.com/rust-lang/blog.rust-lang.org/pull/640
hm yeah I think it doesn't hurt
I don't think it matters much where we put it but we want a post, and I think as a tool release main blog probably is the way to go, it's not really an internal thing

I have a paper bag to wear on my head too
though it's yellow, not brown.
@Pietro Albini I've not heard anything from inejge so I guess we're going ahead when you're ready.
@Daniel Silverstone started!
@Daniel Silverstone done!
merged the blog post as well

equanimity% rustup self update
info: checking for self-updates
info: downloading self-update
  rustup updated - 1.22.1 (from 1.22.0)

equanimity%

Looks good.
